p: Ouabain ( 14), also known as g-strophanthin, is a toxic cardiac glycoside that was traditionally used as an arrow poison for both hunting and warfare in eastern Africa. However, this substance, in lower doses, can be used medically to treat hypotension and some arrhythmias. In addition, ouabain diminishes SARS-CoV titers and the number of SARS-CoV RNA copies at 0–3000 nM (Yang et al. 2018). Wu et al. ( 2020) described drug names, chemical structures, pharmacological functions, and sources of 20 potential RdRp inhibitors from an in-house natural product database. Their results were based on computer virtual screening because no in vitro and in vivo experiments were conducted.
